comments.body:
Hmm, I think that this needs to be specified something like this:

```typescript
capture(id: string, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
capture(id: string, data: charges.IChargeCaptureOptions, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
capture(id: string, options: HeaderOptions, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
capture(id: string, data: charges.IChargeCaptureOptions, options: HeaderOptions, response?: IResponseFn<charges.ICharge>): Promise<charges.ICharge>;
```

since all of this calls are okay:

```js
capture(id)
capture(id, (err) => {})
capture(id, data)
capture(id, data, (err) => {})
capture(id, options)
capture(id, options, (err) => {})
capture(id, data, options)
capture(id, data, options, (err) => {})
```

note that the Stripe client differs `data` from `options` by looking at the keys in the object

any thoughts @lauvigne, @DanielRosenwasser?
Yes you are right, it's better!

since this is a major version upgrade, please take a copy of the old definition files, and put it under a new folder `v4`. see https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#i-want-to-update-a-package-to-a-new-major-version
Have you got any documentation for where you got these properties? I can't seem to find any application object documented on the Stripe API docs.
I see why you've done this though, as the `application` property is `Expandable`
Yes. Actually I figured this out from the official .Net API code. Though there are no docs about this anywhere else and I wasn't able to actually test it.
The field names don't need quotes around them.
Why have these been made optional?
Well, this is primarily a data model object. For some reason when I actually use the library I've noticed the quite often I don't really have these functions available. This is why I did that.
